thread.title: Notre Dame girls soccer team upsets Northwestern
thread.title_full: Notre Dame girls soccer team upsets Northwestern

title: Notre Dame girls soccer team upsets Northwestern
text:
Complete Box Score » 
Notre Dame 2, Northwestern 0 — Rapid Recap 
Freshman forward Mikayla Bates scored two goals as Notre Dame pulled off a 2-0 road win over Northwestern on Tuesday night. 
Turning point : After scoring in the first half, Bates added another goal with 22:32 left in in regulation to give the Crusaders complete control. 
Top performer: Bates scored both goals for the Crusaders. The first one came with 8:11 remaining in the first half off a pass from Katie Aquilina and the second one was unassisted following a scramble in front of Northwestern goalkeeper McKenna Amey with 22:32 left in regulation. As an honorable mention, Notre Dame goalkeeper M'Kenna Murphy made eight saves. 
What it means : It was a rare win for Notre Dame against traditional powerhouse Northwestern and the fifth straight victory for the Crusaders. It was the second straight loss for the Tigers, who will have to rebound with Colonial League and District 11 playoffs fast approaching.
